episodes.title: 'Andrew would have been treated like any other suspect' | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Detectives are continuing their searches of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s former home on the Windsor estate, following his arrest and subsequent release from custody.

He was held on Thursday morning following allegations made against him after the release of files related to paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.

Andrew, who is the first senior royal in modern history to be arrested, was held in custody for around 11 hours before he was released under investigation by Thames Valley Police.

Broadcast on 20/02/2026

episodes.description:
ITV News' Royal Editor Chris Ship and Royal Biographer Andrew Lownie discuss the trade envoy role that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor served in from 2001-2011.

The former duke was detained on Thursday on his 66th birthday over allegations he shared sensitive information with Epstein while serving as the UK’s trade envoy.

episodes.description:
Detectives will continue their searches of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s former home in Berkshire following his release from custody, after he was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

He was held on Thursday morning following allegations made against him after the release of files related to paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.

Andrew, who is the first senior royal in modern history to be arrested, was held in custody for around 11 hours before he was released under investigation by Thames Valley Police.

episodes.title: Police 'assessing' Stansted Airport private flights over Epstein links | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Police are assessing information about private flights to and from Stansted Airport following the publication of millions of files relating to the paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.

It comes after former prime minister Gordon Brown claimed that the newly published files showed in “graphic detail” how Epstein was able to use the Essex-based airport to “fly in girls from Latvia, Lithuania and Russia”.

The politician said Epstein “boasted” about how cheap the airport charges were in Stansted compared to Paris.

episodes.title: Did the Royal Family pay to settle Andrew's court case with Virgina Giuffre?
episodes.description:
It's being reported that the late Queen and King Charles both lent Andrew Mountbatten Windsor millions of pounds to pay off his sex abuse accuser Virginia Giuffre and stop the court case against him.

It comes as prosecutors are speaking to police over allegations the former Prince may have shared confidential trade information with the convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

Andrew has always denied any wrongdoing.

Royal Historian and the author of Andrew's unauthorised biography, Andrew Lownie joins us in the studio.

episodes.title: 'I carried the weight for 35 years' - Epstein survivor on how the past should inform the future
episodes.description:
Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has refused to answer questions at a Congressional hearing in the US. Her lawyer has stated that his client is "prepared to speak fully and honestly if granted clemency by President Trump".

Maxwell appeared virtually from the Texas prison where she is serving a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking.

Jess Michaels was abused by Jeffrey Epstein in the early 90s and came forward after he died in 2019. She reported she had been abused by him but says she was not listened to. She also credits Virginia Giuffre for 'saving her life' after seeing her bravery in going public.

She joins Susanna and Ed from Washington D.C.

episodes.title: Epstein survivor calls on Andrew to 'do the right thing' and testify | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
A Jeffrey Epstein survivor is calling on Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor to "do the right thing" and testify as part of investigations into the disgraced financier.

Marina Lacerda was abused by Epstein when she was 14 after emigrating to the US from Brazil.

Andrew has previously denied any wrongdoing over his links to Epstein but has not directly responded to the latest allegations.

episodes.title: William and Kate 'deeply concerned' by Jeffrey Epstein scandal | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
The Prince and Princess of Wales have been “deeply concerned” by the ongoing revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein scandal involving Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Kensington Palace has said.

It is the first time William and Kate have publicly commented on the crisis that has engulfed the monarchy and Westminster, and their thoughts “remain focused on the victims”.

The prince is en route to Saudi Arabia for the start of a three-day tour of the Middle East country, spending his first day with the Saudi ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

episodes.title: Should Starmer go? Ed and Susanna ask former Labour MP Diane Abbott | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Former Labour MP Diane Abbott says Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer 'knew more' about Lord Peter Mandelson as he faces increasing pressure after the resignation of his top aide.

The Prime Minister's right hand man, Morgan McSweeney, resigned as his Chief of Staff this weekend as he took 'full responsibility' for advising Keir Starmer to appoint Lord Mandelson as the UK's Ambassador to the US.

'This idea that Starmer didn't know, I think that's quite misleading,' MP Diane Abbott told Good Morning Britain.

episodes.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor 'On FBI shortlist' | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
New files suggest he was on an FBI shortlist of “prominent names” flagged during the bureau's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The document refers to allegations that the former Prince took part in adult parties and was given sexual favours to make him “happy”.  Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has always denied any wrongdoing.

And the Prime Minister is still dealing with his own fallout from the Epstein scandal. After his grovelling apology yesterday, there are reports this morning that his former deputy is "ready" to take over and the Labour grandee, Baroness Harriet Harman, has called him " weak, naive and gullible."

Ranvir Singh and Kate Garraway were joined by former Conservative special adviser Salma Shah and former Labour minister Caroline Flint to discuss more.
-------------------------------------------------------

episodes.title: 'He told me what he was into' - Epstein Survivor Rina Oh shares her story
episodes.description:
Rina Oh was a young student when she was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein in 2000. An aspiring artist, she hoped he might open professional doors for her.

He paid her university tuition fees and provided her with an apartment in New York. But Rina soon discovered nothing with Epstein came for free.

episodes.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's email suggests Andrew and Virginia Giuffre photo is real
episodes.description:
Emails released by the US Justice Department suggest that the infamous photo showing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor stood next to Virginia Giuffre is real.

The former Duke of York has previously questioned the validity of the image of him with Ms Giuffre, formerly known as Virginia Roberts.

Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has always denied any wrongdoing.

Meanwhile, the lawyer who's represented Epstein survivors for nearly two decades says it’s time for the powerful men involved in the story to speak - under oath - so victims can finally get answers.

Spencer Kuvin represented Epstein's first victim and is still in contact with others.

He believes if Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has nothing to hide, he should testify before congress and even be extradited.

--------------------------------------------------------------

episodes.title: Labour MP defends Starmer's action on Mandelson
episodes.description:
Sir Keir Starmer is fighting for his political future after he admitted he knew about Mandelson's friendship with Epstein when he picked him for the job as US ambassador, but claimed he 'lied repeatedly' about the extent of the relationship. 

This morning, Housing Secretary Steve Reed said giving him the role was "a rational appointment".

The police have launched an investigation into misconduct in a public office in relation to Lord Mandelson - after it was alleged he shared sensitive information with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

He is yet to comment publicly on the allegations, but has said that he regrets his friendship with Epstein.

episodes.title: Pressure builds on Andrew to testify at US Congress over Epstein | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor should be extradited to testify before the US Congress about his links to Jeffrey Epstein, a lawyer for some of Epstein's victims told ITV News.

"The US Department of Justice needs to utilise the abilities they have... to enforce [Andrew's] testimony and potentially prosecute him in the states and extradite him," Spencer Kuvin, a lawyer representing some of Epstein's victims, said.

It comes after photos of the disgraced royal featured in the latest disclosure of files related to the paedophile financier.

Images appearing to show Andrew kneeling on all fours over an unidentified woman lying down on the floor are featured in the latest disclosure by the US Department of Justice on Friday, which included more than three million documents.

Andrew has always vehemently denies any allegations of wrongdoing.

episodes.title: Lord Mandelson could face police investigation over Epstein information leak | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer is preparing to chair a meeting with his Cabinet as police assess accusations that Lord Peter Mandelson leaked sensitive information from the Government to the late convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

The Metropolitan Police is reviewing reports of alleged misconduct in a public office after the US Justice Department released millions of pages as part of the so-called Epstein files.

Starmer has called for the former ambassador to Washington to quit the House of Lords, as Downing Street said the prime minister believes Mandelson should “not be a member… or use the title”.

He has tasked the country's top civil servant with carrying out a review.

episodes.title: Andrew biographer calls for police investigation into former prince | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
Royal Historian and Andrew Mountbatten Windsor's unofficial biographer Andrew Lownie has called for a police investigation into the former Prince following several damaging revelations in the Epstein files. 

Photos released from Epstein's files over the weekend by the U.S. Justice Department appear to show Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor crouched over an unidentified young woman lying on the floor. 

Calls are growing for Andrew to testify to US Congress and some are calling for a full police investigation in the UK. 

Andrew has always denied any wrongdoing. 

Sarah Ferguson has previously said "I abhor paedophilia and any sexual abuse of children. I cannot state more strongly that I know a terrible, terrible error of judgement was made, my having anything to do with Jeffrey Epstein. What he did was wrong and for which he was rightly jailed.”

episodes.title: Digital Danger: How Britain's Strictest Headteacher Is Tackling School Misogyny
episodes.description:
A new survey has laid bare the misogyny children see at school, with one in five nine to thirteen-year-olds seeing sexual messages on phones at least once a week.

Katharine Birbalsingh, who's been dubbed Britain's strictest headteacher, discusses her experiences. Matt Shea, a documentary filmmaker who has met Andrew Tate several times, discusses the influence Andrew Tate has on young boys and girls.

Broadcast on 01/05/25

episodes.title: Rebekah Vardy Opens Up About Childhood Abuse | Good Morning Britain
episodes.description:
'I was scared of what the consequences of speaking out would actually do.'

Rebekah Vardy has accused the Jehovah’s Witnesses of having covered up the sexual abuse she suffered as a child.

Rebekah, who has made a Channel 4 documentary about her ordeal, tells 
Susanna Reid and Ed Balls about how she felt like she couldn't reach out to anyone when she was younger.
